reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only because our usual hotel was booked, and we were making the arrangements last minute.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inkeeper was fairly pleasant (even though she was more concerned with whatever she was cooking - which smelled awful - than helping us check-in).
reviews.title: Great location, but in need of some TLC

likes.liked: — Windows open listening to the waves

reviews.text: The rooms are nice enough. The beds were incredibly hard, and the pillows are like bricks (and weigh just about as much as one).
reviews.title: Not the worst place, but I expected better...

reviews.text: The location of this motel is great, but for the high price, I expected more.
reviews.title: Make sure you call many times to confirm your reservation
No need to beware
reviews.text: This motel has lovely potential, as it is situated across the road from the beach, and close to the town centre. However, its a little run down, and it would be good if the bathroom door closed! The room was very clean, but for the price you pay, you'd at least expect to get a coffee in the morning. But if looking for somewhere to go for breakfast, we can recommend 'The Greenery', great food and views.

reviews.title: Beware- Peg Leg Motel is not the Peg Leg Inn
reviews.text: This is not for the Peg Leg Inn, but rather the Peg Leg Motel. They are located next to each other and from what we understand, are not affiliated with one another. The Peg Leg Inn is definately the nicer of the two places. The Motel had a comfortable bed, but that is the only good quality of the place. For $150/night, I would expect a lot more than what we got. We wore our flip flops in the room b/c without any A/C, the entire room was damp. The decor is very dated and you only get two towels. The Motel is directly across from a small beach area, but the Inn is literally two buildings down. A lot of people confuse the two and expect the Inn and get the Motel. Both are walking distance from downtown and are in great locations.
